kpi.title: KPI Table
kpi.desc: KPIs about the use of electric aircraft.

emissions.title: Electric Aircraft - Emissions by scenario
emissions.kpi: KPIs relative to the deployment of electric aircraft in Italy.

eurokpi.title: Economic KPI Table
eurokpi.caption: KPIs relative to the monetary savings from the introduction of electric aircraft in Italy.

s1.description: The four estimates are derived from the combination of two key parameters (emissions for energy generation and electric aircraft power consumption).

first.description: The first code (IT/EU) is about the energy production emission estimates:
first.IT: IT: Italy power generation emissions according to ISPRA (259,3 g CO₂ / kWh)
first.EU: EU: average European Union power generation emissions (334 g CO₂ / kWh)

s1.second: The second code (ES-19 / LF) is about electric aircraft power consumption estimates:

s2s3.description: Both estimates (EU 2030 and EU Fully Renewable) are based on an estimated energy consumption of 0,167 kWh / (seat × km) for electric aircraft.
s2s3.code: The two estimates differ in the considered level of power generation emissions:
s2s3.EU30: EU 2030: European Union target for power generation emissions in 2030 (114 g CO₂ / kWh)s
s2s3.EUFR: EU Fully Renewable: European Union net zero target for power generation emissions (0 g CO₂ / kWh)

table.title: Estimated % usage of biometric technologies at selected

demand.title: Passenger and freight flight forecasts for Italy

yearly.legend: Historical trend in black, forecasts in blue, confidence interval on forecasts in pink

description.passenger: Effective yearly passenger traffic (in millions) until 2024 and estimated volumes until 2035
description.freight: Freight traffic volume (in millions of metric tons) until 2022 and estimated volumes from 2025 until 2035

model.title: Model
model.m2: Maximization of the number of substituted ground transport routes

footer.movements: maximizes the amount of replaced ground movements.

captions.electric: This section of the dashboard provides an overview of the potential impact of employing electric aricraft. By selecting technical parameters such as operating range and seat capacity, it's possible to analyze inter-European routes that could be operated with such aircraft. The dashboard offers several KPIs regarding the overall number of affected flights, fuel savings, emission reduction and the effect on operating costs, accompanied by the display of potentially replaceable routes.
captions.emissions: This section of the dashboard provides an overview of Italian domestic routes that, varying on the technical specifications of aircraft such as operating range and seat capacity, could be operated by electric aircraft. Three scenarios are displayed, each based on a type of aircraft currently being developed: Scenario 1 – Heart Aerospace ES-19; Scenario 2 – Elysian E9X; Scenario 3 – Wright Project.
captions.biometric: This section of the dashboard allows to estimate the potential use of facial recognition technology in airport processes. Starting from several parameters from the traditional process, such as airfare, wait times at security checks and at the gate, the modality of acquisition of biometric data (at home or at the airport) and the processing time with facial recognition, the chart displays the adoption rate for the service as a function of the biometrical airport process relative to the baseline (Δ%). The results are divided by business passengers, leisure passengers and the overall population.
captions.social: This section of the dashboard provides estimates of welfare variation, profits and consumer surplus (net of variations tied to lower greenhouse emissions) determined by the introduction of electric aircraft. By selecting operating range, seat capacity and marginal cost variation associated to the electric aircraft, it's possible to observe the implication of a 1-to-1 substitution on the entire observation period (2014-2019 and 2022-2023).
captions.demand: A preliminary step to WP6 activities involved the forecasting of air transport evolution in a time period marked by high uncertainty, due both to the recovery phase that followed the COVID-19 pandemic and to vicissitudes tied to both the ongoing conflicts. This section of the dashboard displays the results of forecast models for passenger and freight traffic, referring to the Italian airport system. The passenger traffic forecasts were obtained from an integrated model for demand estimation, which allows to consider both demand generation and its allocation on different itineraries. The model, fine-tuned on historical data, allowed the production of forward-looking estimates based on the evolution of air networks and on macroeconomic trends. The freight traffic estimation model is instead based on historical series analysis, using macroeconomic forecasts as additional inputs.
captions.drone: This section concerns the project activities aimed at quantifying the potential use of cargo drones to replace ground transport in the middle-mile network of Poste Italiane (project partner). In particular, the dashboard will show the results of an optimization model aimed at identifying which part of the middle-mile distribution network in Tuscany and Umbria can be operated by cargo drones, in response to the variation of the size of the fleet and the objective considered.
